moves.2. Nf3 f6: i would consider f6 a bad move
moves.3. d4 d6: white begins to take control of the center
moves.4. dxe5 fxe5: after exchange, black king is expose
moves.6. b4 b5: b4 is a agressive move, now black cannot castle on either side
moves.7. h4 Be7: h4 is another agressive move, he has plans to attack
moves.9. g4 g6: another bold move by white, at this point i didn't see the whole plan yet
moves.10. Bh3 Nc6: it seems the pawn on h4 is up for grabs, but white has a master plan
moves.11. g5 Nxb4: Nb4 is another waste of time, he doesn't see the danger of white pieces attacking
moves.12. Nd5 Nxd5: the exchange of knights only brings advantage to white
moves.13. exd5 h6: black's bishop on b7 is not going anywhere. now black is trying to attack but its a bit too late
moves.14. O-O hxg5: white is full of confidence, he doesn't bother about the pawns. he is looking at the bigger picture
moves.15. Be6 gxh4: bishop on e6 is a grandmaster's move
moves.16. Qd3 Rh6: queen threaten's mate, black is forced to defend with the only piece available
moves.17. Bc1 Rh7: i would have given up my rook but it only delays what is coming
moves.18. Qxg6+ Kf8: truly sorry for black as he had no chance of defending, nice game
